intro: Erigeron spinosus, commonly known as the spiny fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It features hairy, spiny stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers, which bloom in the summer, consist of both ray and disk florets, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
